content: * *Braddell Heights Single Member Constituency** was a constituency in Singapore. It existed from 1976 to 1997 and was merged into [Marine Parade Group Representation Constituency](/wiki/Marine_Parade_Group_Representation_Constituency) in 1997. ## History In 1976, **Braddell Heights Constituency** was formed by merging parts of Serangoon Gardens, Thomson, Upper Serangoon, Aljunied and Paya Lebar constituencies together. In 1984, rrior to the [1984 general election](/wiki/1984_Singaporean_general_election), [Lee Khoon Choy](/wiki/Lee_Khoon_Choy) stepped down from his parliamentary positions and did not contest the elections. In 1988, following the establishment of [Group representation constituency](/wiki/Group_representation_constituency) (GRC) and SMC, it was known as Braddell Heights SMC. In 1997, the SMC was merged into [Marine Parade Group Representation Constituency](/wiki/Marine_Parade_Group_Representation_Constituency). ## Member of Parliament **Year** **Member****Party****Formation**(/wiki/1976_Singaporean_general_election)[Lee Khoon Choy](/wiki/Lee_Khoon_Choy)[PAP](/wiki/People%27s_Action_Party)(/wiki/1980_Singaporean_general_election)(/wiki/1984_Singaporean_general_election)Goh Choon Kang[PAP](/wiki/People%27s_Action_Party)(/wiki/1988_Singaporean_general_election)(/wiki/1991_Singaporean_general_election)**Constituency abolished (1997)** ## Electoral results Note: The [Elections Department](/wiki/Elections_Department_Singapore) does not include rejected votes when calculating the vote shares of candidates. Hence, all candidates' vote shares will total to 100% at any given election (may not appear so in multi-way contests due to rounding). ### Elections in 1970s [General Election
